BJs as a franchise is awesome. I have been to this location many times but tonight was just awful. The food is always great but service is what makes or breaks the experience. Tonight was not busy but the wait for food and drinks was outrageously long. The server Yanira was rude and unattentive to our party of five. We asked for our checks to be split into three and her attitude went south. Our drinks took longer and longer to come out and when asked about a promotional deal, she was not happy. It's not like she is paying for the free pizookie, BJs is. All I can honestly say is that tonight would have been a descent night if we had a server who actually would do their job without such a bad attitude and a smile. Even a fake smile would have been fine with us.

In one word: terrible! . My wife ordered a thin crust pizza and instead got a pizza where the dough was at least 1" think. The drinks were "stuffed" with ice cubes resulting in a watered down experience. I ordered the barbacoa with cauliflower - the waiter explained that the barbacoa was not meat but simply a sauce. Well, the dish contained small pieces of chicken, no barbacoa sauce and not cauliflowers but pieces of cucumber. I know we should have returned both dishes but we were in a hurry. This restaurant will never see us again.!!

BJ's is one of my favorite go-to restaurants when I am craving American food. This location is big and clean. I've been to BJ's in Cerritos and Del Amo Mall and they all look the same. Service is always good at any BJ's location I have been to. If you had to try one thing I suggest their deep dish pizzas. It is so mouthwatering and delicious. The bread is so plump and fluffy. My favorite flavor is the BBQ chicken. I also love getting the pastas here, the garlic bread that comes with the pasta is delicious as well. If you want to try an appetizer I suggest the avocado egg rolls. For the beer, I tried the tatonka stout (8.5% alch) and it was great.  For dessert try the pizookies! They have multiple flavors and seem to have a new flavor on the menu every so often. The pizookie is a freshly baked hot cookie with icecream on top. It is the perfect combo. The cookie smells so fresh and every bite is amazing.  If you come with a big party there may be a long wait, so I suggest calling ahead and making reservations. Also, if you come here often you should sign up for the BJs rewards program. You accumulate points after every meal and can get discounts or free pizookies depending on your point value.

It was my first time yesterday trying this place out, I ordered the house sirloin steak with mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese. Never again will I come here! The service was very blah and I order my steak medium well, my steak was overly cooked and the Mac and cheese was not good at all. The Kraft Mac and cheese from a box is 10x better. I didn't enjoy my food at all, it was nothing to what I expected and I wouldn't come here again. Not worth what my friend and I paid for.

Our Server was Gerardo tonight, excellent customer service! He was so attentive to our needs and just a great personality overall. We have been here many times but today our visit stands out. It's people like him that deserve the reviews, doing your above and beyond. The food was delish too. Thank you again BJ's will be back soon.

I was honestly completely shocked during our visit at this BJs location. I've been to several other locations and never had such a great experience. Our service was amazing. Angela was very attentive. She brought refills early, extra sauces before we even had a chance to ask and even had a stack of napkins on our table before our food arrived. When you eat out with 4 kids you never know what kind of service you'll get. Sometimes children turn a server off and they try to ignore the kids completely, not Angie! She spoke directly to our kids and let them order for themselves which they LOVED. She had a smile on her face the entire time and never appeared frustrated even though she had several tables in her section.  We ordered an appetizer sampler, large deep dish pizza, BBQ chicken salad and a guacamole burger on special. Everything was very good and cooked exactly how we ordered it.  The only unfortunate thing is that we don't live in the area and the BJs closest to us has never been impressive. If you live nearby, definitely eat here! If you've previously given this place a lower review, you're sitting in the wrong servers section.

Stopped in here for lunch today. The BJs salad was excellent I had Bacon ranch wife had Lemon thyme chicken mine was OK hers was on the salty side. The tea was also excellent .all in all I think what we picked for lunch was just the wrong choice for this day . I will eat at BJ's agin and not even think about this one time .. have ate at other BJ's and always was happy but anyone that's comes to bjs must try their salad .... also the service was very good .....

If I could give them a 0 I would. I went with my family today ( Sunday around 4 pm). Party of 4 with 2 being kids. After 45 minutes they were still working on our food. The worst service , I had to walk out . I asked to speak to the manager , Leo , and he never made it to our table . Won't be coming back to BJ's again . You lost a customer -
Timothy M. Was such a great server! I wish more were like him, he made our dinner experience a 5 out of 5 ! Will return just because of Tim!

Came in during the crazy football season. Place is ok on time if you don't mind waiting. Staff is nice but one guy is super welcoming, Tim. Funny dude too!Helped us out explaining then bjs points and remembered us from the last time. Made us feel like regulars for sure. Good job BJs.

I came here with a group of people from work on a Sunday night. Food was so-so. The buffalo chicken pizza I ordered wasn't as good as the ones I've had at other locations. This one was way too dry and not very flavorful. Our server was very friendly but his service was kind of slow. It took forever for him to bring our check out and when he did there were extra charges on there. We asked him to fix it and he disappeared for the longest time before coming back with the correct check. He also took his sweet time getting us boxes....I think he might've been new. But at least he was always friendly and checked up on us throughout the meal. Overall, there are better BJ's locations.

I took my family for lunch today. TIMOTHY WAS our server and was beyond excellent. He was very attentive and actually took the time to talk to us. We received the best service in have had there because of him. Would definitely go back because of him.

The chocolate chunk pizookie is a great dessert to have after your wonderful meal. I also tried the berry burst cider and it was delicious, it's reminded me of Stella Rosa. It was sweet but not too sweet. For my meal I got the quinoa bowl with salmon.  They have other options like chicken, shrimp and vegetarian. There's plenty of parking  because it is located next to stone wood mall.  There are other restaurants nearby as well. Happy eating!

Nice and very spacious BJ's. First time visit to this location. Service was good, drinks were great but food should have been warmer. Big plus for opening until 1:00am on Fridays and Saturdays. Restaurant appeared well staffed on this Saturday night and there was plenty of parking.

This location is ok! I got seated right away as it was a Tuesday I guess.  The service needs to improve though.  The decor was okay and it took forever to join the rewards program.  I liked my food, but the steak was a bit dry. Even though I got it well-done, they should add moisture.

Three stars mostly for the service. The workers were very friendly and prompt and helping me out.  The food however was pretty mediocre. Would I go back again? Maybe, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Had Anthony C as our server for lunch time today & must I say he was super attentive and speedy! My sister and I had half bone in buffalo wings and lemon pepper, a delicious tortilla bowl ! I recommend the deep dish ziti bowl I had today it was perfectly cooked and brought out as soon as we were done with our appetizer ! The staff here is always friendly and joyful!

I have been to this restaurant more than enough to attempt to give an adequate review but today was probably the last time we go. I would rather drive to a farther one. There service is terrible. It took over an hour to get food and it was not that busy. They looked short staffed and not aware of customer service at all. We had to wait to get napkins and silverware while we sat and picked at our salads with our hands...by the time we got our food is was cold and we barely got refills on our water. This place needs to seriously work on customer service and timing of food. Our server acted like we were bothering her every time we asked for more water or something

Extremely poor service today. Ordered Piranha Nachos and they were horrific.  Tortilla chips were as if someone crushed them up with their hands. Little to no chili  / cheese  -slathered w/ warm sour cream.  Waiting now more than 45 minutes for our entrées - salads !!!!! Was just your typical salad with mostly lettuce - not a lot of anything else. I had the Santa Fe Salad and substituted w/ Cajun Shrimp. Shrimp good but  cold. Probably prior made and refrigerated.  May or may not be back. Totally not worth the money we paid for our meals. Server was Cynthia A. Not her fault the kitchen items were not up to standards.

This is by far the worst restaurant I've ever been to. I visited this restaurant on a Sunday for brunch with my boyfriend , I ordered a deep dish pizza . Half ways thru the pizza I found a piece of glass . I little too late since I had already put it in my mouth and bite it. I immediately spit it out. We got our waitress and called it to her attention , although we got some kind of discount on our tab I find it unexceptional. This is by far the worst incautious restaurant I will never be eating here again.

Parking was a mess! That alone made me want to leave but I do love BJ's just not this location so much. Very crowded, our seating was by the cashier for the waiters so I constantly was hearing their gossip and gripes. Our waitresses were nice, except for one took forever to take our order because she thought the other one had taken it...communication is key! The food was delicious as always. Tasted the new watermelon salad and I was in love. Such a perfect and refreshing salad for summertime. I'm a fan of their small bites plates because they are a good size for a great price. The buffalo pizza is my favorite, usually order a mini and a small bite (stuffed mushrooms, mozzarella and tomato, or bruschetta). Pzookies are a must, the sampler is the best bet if you're sharing.

I've been here on several occasions &, it's sad to say, that the experiences have been getting worse & worse every time. The food is okay, nothing special really. The service is slow and not very good. On today's visit, the server got 3 things on our order wrong, seemed like the only thing he was on top of was refilling drinks. All in all, I'd go back just because there are not many options in the immediate area but I would not go out of my way to visit this location again.
Great service and ridiculously priced lunch specials. My meal here was cheaper than a drive thru visit to Carls Jr.

Eaten at BJ in several cities. It is Monday night football and after 11 minutes of waiting i had to flag a waitress. Had to walk to the bar to get my own beer. Never had a bad experience until this visit. Absolutely terrible service.

Went to this bjs location on a Saturday night for a few drinks and sat at the bar. I usually enjoy seating at the bar butt this time around I did not enjoy seating at the bar at all. First the bartenders were not friendly or welcoming at all. They never asked if we wanted more drinks after we were done with our first drink. The bartenders seemed not interested In taking our food order. They even seemed annoyed that we asked for sides. The food was good and it came out right away after we were able to place the order. No complaints about the food. Good customer Service overall at the bar was lacking.
Love the pizzas! Black and blue burger! Everything I get here is delicious. I always sit in the bar area, their happy hour is awesome. Bartender service varies but David is always friendly and fast.

Last night I took my wife for dinner and we decided to give BJ's a try. I am so glad we did. The place is great from the inside, the lighting is just perfect. The greeting was welcoming and friendly. We requested booth seating and this was accommodated with pleasure. We enjoyed great dishes, the Calamari was fantastic, the deep dish pizza was very good, the chicken fettuccine pasta was a little below average to our taste because it was rather dry. Then we tried their signature dessert the Pizookie!! It comes in different flavors, and we tried the triple chocolate Pizookie, it was just exquisite and very tasty! Definitely worth a try.  Advice: Give BJ a try!

The service and quality of food at this place has gone downhill. Today, our server got our order wrong three times. The food was mediocre had the turkey club sandwich which was very bland and the BJ's Pizza deep dish crust--the crust was not as crispy as other times and didn't have an even distribution of the toppings. I counted TWO MUSHROOMS in the overall pizza. Overall nothing special to keep me coming back to this place. Don't think I'll be back again.
Pretty busy last tonight! Service was a bit slow but overall food was great! Took our server a few minutes to come get our drink and order but then again she probably had a lot of tables.
Tip of the day: if you're in the mood for alcohol and dessert, try a pizookie with a PM Porter beer. Big thanks to my server Tiffany for this tasty recommendation.

Ok so let me start off by saying I've been to multiple locations of bjs and I've never had an issue, until this past weekend at the Downey location. I went on a Friday night at around 9:30, my boyfriend got us a booth at the bar section and the waitress seemed very nice, a few minutes later she came to tell us she was done for the night and a waitress who's name starts with a "D" was gonna serve us for the remainder of the night, ok fair enough. She asked if we were ready to order and we said we needed a few more minutes. She didn't return for about 20 minutes if not longer. She hardly even made eye contact with us so we couldn't wave her over. Once we made eye contact with her we waved and she took our order. When the food came, they didn't give us utensil or napkins so we waited about another 15 min for the napkins and utensils. We really felt like she was purposely avoiding us. We thought maybe it was because it was only the 2 of us at a booth and that annoyed her, I really don't know. That night we were there from 9:30 to 12 am, we would have left earlier but an hour if not more was spent by us waiting to get service. In the time we were there the waitress only stopped by our booth 4 times, all 4 times because we had to wave her over. This girl made it so difficult just to get a beer. She would walk past our booth and wouldn't make eye contact with us or asked if we were doing alright. I've never experienced this at any other bjs. We weren't rude or obnoxious, we sat quietly at the booth so I still can't figure out why she would be avoiding our booth. And no, it wasn't overly busy that night, it was a regular Friday night type of crowd and we noticed everyone else at her section was getting served. I'm very disappointed especially since I love the bjs franchise. Not cool bjs, not cool at all.

I ordered two pizzas one hand tossed and deep dish. The pizzas were very salty especially the deep dish with extra pepperoni. The pizza was also not hot was very lukewarm. We had one large and two small's with three drinks total price 68 dollars.  I would've rather had an 8 dollar deep dish pizza at Little Caesars.

So, we had a high school grad that decided he wanted to eat here. Let me start by saying that the hostess said it'd be a 30 minute wait. Of course, an hour later, our large party started getting frustrated because we were told they were waiting for two girls to finish eating  to clear up an area for us. Surprise, surprise-- they finished and then sat another party that arrived after us there. As we asked why that happened, the manager told us they honor reservations first. Wtf, she could have said that before pissing us all off. The staff simply doesn't know how to communicate clear expectations with their clients. We were finally seated in two separate areas. Our waitress was ok but seemed too stressed for a large group. I personally had to ask 3 different employees, including the manager, to change a channel to the Dodger game.They all said yes and never did. I hate to be an AHole, so I let it go. Other TVs away from us had the game going. So this is what prompted me to write this review and knocked a few stars down in the service department. The manager did send some courtesy avocado egg rolls after we ordered. That was kind of her; she later did come to apologize about the fiasco. However, you can't excuse poor service because the restaurant is busy. Later, we got a different server to replace our first, and he was great! He even brought out complimentary deserts for our graduate. I was at one star at the time. The food was average. My cheese and tomato pizza wasn't any better than Pizza Hut's, but the beer and wine was good. The prices are reasonable as well. The environment was clean but I personally don't like to be surrounded by cholitos, so I'd go elsewhere. So if you want great service here, don't get your hopes too high. As for the food--simply average.  Two stars for food and service.

First, my 2 friends and I (2 African-American and one Hispanic) were being led to the rear of the restaurant. I objected and we were told we could sit in the bar area, as there "weren't any servers" in the middle of the restaurant. We were seated in the rear of the bar  10 minutes later, that area was full of other customers. Second, one fork was filthy, it was replaced by a second filthy fork. These dirty forks were replaced by plastic utensils. Then the server took a long time to bring crackers, which should be readily available and not take over 10 minutes to get. Then, the manager comps a dessert; which had a hair in it! The manager offers a coupon for the same dessert which had a hair in it! The whole time, the server is barely coming around to check on our table. The manager then gives a small discount and offers gift card....NEVER AGAIN! The restaurant was full of white people who seemed like they were all very happy with their experience. I'm only giving one star because I have to.

Horrible service!  Their "5 minute" wait was actually well over 20 minutes.  Long time to get seated,  long time to order, Long time to get our food.  At least let me know you're running behind,  I would be more understanding and not give a 1 star review.  :p. The BJ's in Cerritos is 10 times better!

We had the worst service. We waited 10 minutes to be seated. We then waited another 15 minutes to order drinks. We waited an hour for our food which was cold when we got it. I ordered soup in a bread bowl got it in a regualr bowl. (Wasnt too big of a deal). But he did replace it. He then charged me for two soups and an extra loaf of bread, when i told him about it he argued.  I will probably never come back to this bjs. They have terrible service. We got here at 10 and didnt leave till 1. It was a terrible experience.

I did not have a good experience at this location!! It was not busy AT ALL . We were seated our drink order was taken. 35 minutes later our waitress showed to introduce the shift change and new waiter - it got better we, I mentioned I would pay for drinks and leave he took our order and served us promptly.  The "manager/Chef comes out and asked "what my problem was" blank stare** really, well nothing AFTER we ate FINALLY and sat waiting for 45 minutes to have our order taken, watched as other visitors were seated, ate and left. The new waiter proceeded to give us a free pizzookie for the inconvenience...thanks but no thanks I rather have better service.

Waited 15 minutes for someone to take my take out order. Once it hit the 25 minute mark I left. No one acknowledge my presence not even the simple "Someone will help you shortly, I'm sorry for the wait."

Service blows. I sat at the bar for happy hour. We didn't get menus for 7 minutes (I timed it). I had to walk to the host and grab them myself. There wasn't a server in sight. I think they're also the cooks because there wasn't one server on the floor. We finally got a server to come to the table (now 15 minutes in). Food was basic. The sweet big personal pan pizza was soggy. The avocado eggrolls were not crispy. I don't even want to speak about the burger. They were in the kitchen for a while. The food looked like it was sitting under the food lamp for a while. 20 minutes later Mirella  (the waitress, i don't know how to spell her name) came back to "refill" our water and drop off our check. We were going to pay  with a card but she took so long to come back (she probably went to go pump water from the well) that we just paid in cash. She got like a .18 cents tip. She shouldn't have gotten anything. It was the worst service I've ever received.

If I could rate this place a 0, I would. I've given this place 3 chances to impress me or at least not to disappoint. Last night's dinner was the straw that broke the camel's back. I ordered the Tuscan Chicken Limone with angel hair pasta and must I say the pasta had absolutely no salt it was so bland and flavorless. I had to pour the bottle of pepper to give it some type of flavor. Even the raspberry iced tea was bland. I don't know what it is about this chain of restaurants that just can't get things even decently tasty.  I WILL NOT GO BACK THERE AGAIN!

Amazing service!! We were celebrating my uncle's wedding and in total we were a group of 16. It was last minute and were already told that we would most likely will be 1 hour wait. We were ok with that since we never made a reservation.I noticed that one of the hostess and other co-workers were working and organizing a section to sit our whole family, The restaurant was full and they got it done within 20 minutes. The food we ordered came out quick. Our servers were very polite and attentive. Food was great. I would like to mention Yanira for her excellent service and great attitude and the whole staff that made this experience a great one.

Food is always good beer is nice and cold but the service at the downy one sucks first time I went to BJ's there it took an hour at the table just to get service second time I went we waited 40 minutes for our food and they weren't  even packed then we never got a refill and we needed more napkins didn't get that till the end we needed more silverware we ask the different waiter did the survey all I got her response was sorry come back soon miss me with all that 10% or a free appetizer on your next visit would've been nice I will just drive to Cerrito's for now on

This place is a joke along with management! Ghetto and unprofessional managers who lack listening skills. Here I am complaining about how shitty the food is and asking to be remade, instead of going to the kitchen to get me my damn food, he was scolding the waitress near the restrooms. Smh never coming back here again
Single star for the nice server. According to the hubster and the toddler, it was my fault, I chose the chain.  Boo hiss never again :-(

Horrible service!!! Took 25 min to even be acknowledged after being seated... Took 4 waiters to get ranch not to mention my food came out 20 min after all my family had theirs and I only got a club sandwich!!! When spoke to the manager and told him food came out late he said "wonderful" EXCUSE me how is that wonderful!!! I live so close to bj but I rather drive to Cerritos and get WONDER service there!!!
Great food and customer service. Need I say more?  Thanks Chris Robles for the great service.

Was in there last night for a friends birthday party and I just wanted to say that Demetree(no idea how to spell that name) the bartender was really awesome. It's nice to come across bartenders that know their stuff and give awesome service.  He was really cool and helped me decide what beer I'd like out of their house brews.. Thanks for the great service..Cheers!

I went to BJ''s Downey for lunch today and was not happy with their service and food. Let me start by saying we arrived there around lunch time walked straight to the bar and sat ourselves down. We were approached after a couple of minutes by a server and were asked if we were ready to order and we were so we did, that was the end of our good experience. I ordered the soup and salad, I had requested extra cilantro and avocado on my soup and neither happened when it arrived I asked my server that I had ordered extra cilantro etc. and she's basically arguing with me that I already have extra on my soup needless to say I told her to bring me more..she did finally. My kid ordered the kids Alfredo/broccoli pasta and it had a big hair implanted on the dish next to the pasta I called over the manager and he agreed to make another one  which but at which point I was already done with my meal. They had the audacity to charge for my kids meal in spite of the huge inconvenience. What I failed to mention was the fact that it was my sons birthday and with all the time wasted we had no time for his pizzokie which he was looking forward to. Needless to say not going back to Bj's anytime soon.

BJ's pizza is pretty standard fare, but they get an extra star for being really nice.  You already know the food, and the main courses themselves probably get only 3 stars, but the pizookie dessert is really spectacular and the entire review gets an extra star bump just for that. Parking is obviously ample since it's Stonewood mall and the service was pretty fast during a busy lunch hour. The pizookie is great, the service is well above average, and the beers are actually high quality.  I'm looking to try a beer flight during my next visit to a BJ's. I've heard great things about their ales.

Drinks are good and there is such a wide selection. But the service is horrible especially on weekends. Waited over 40 min for appetizer and it was the wrong one. Then they brought our dishes one at a time so we could eat in stages and not as a group. So not coming back to this location.

The food on most chain restaurants is usually good but BJ's is by far the best chain restaurant in town and the customer service is awesome. I have never had anything I didn't like from the buffalo chicken pizza drizzled in ranch, bar-b-que chicken pizza, great white and my new favorite...grilled chicken pesto with parmiggiano reggiano sprinkled on top. Avocado eggrolls, club sandwiches, chicken pasta and many things. But don't forget dessert even if you're full take it to go!!!! Pizookie is delicious, they can give you two flavors of cookie and do halfs, they have mini ones too if you're watching your diet. I feel like I'm advertising but BJ's deserves it.

Great service!!!  Our server @ the downey location was Chris.  He was attentive,  knowledgeable about the menu, always remembers me when we come in.  They also have happy hour all day when pro football Is on on sunday.

The food was really good! My group ordered a couple of things and just ate family style. Ordered a veggie pizza. Hit the spot. Pie was tasty and the bread was good. Also ordered the chicken club with some fries. That blew me away. The chicken was grilled to perfection. Ordered a chicken salad, which was fresh and tasty. It had corn and beans which gave it a great taste perfect for the summer. Just is. Our appetizers were good. Calamari was fresh and it was not chewy. Now comes the bad part. I would have given this place 4 stars, but the hostesses sucked! I don't know what it is, but good looking hostesses who spend half their time talking to their friends who work with them instead of greeting people and making them feel welcome is my pet peeve. It would be nice to walk in and be greeted, instead of waking in and waiting to talk to someone to be seated. I really don't care about eye candy at the front door. I care about feeling welcomed to a place that I am going to spend my hard earned money.

Food was pretty good as usual. We were in town visiting from Fresno and got in kinda late but fortunately BJ'S was still open. However service was terrible. Our waiter disappeared halfway through our meal, never came to check on us or ask if we wanted to order pizookie (which originally we wanted to do) it wasn't until we were finished with our meal ready for boxes and brought boxes until we were asked if we wanted to order pizookie. Naturally we said no because we're aware pizookie takes a while and it was already approaching 11 p.m. After he dropped off the boxes he disappeared again for 15 minutes before coming back to ask if we wanted additional boxes we said no and he told us he'd bring back our bill. It wasn't until 11:28 until he brought back our crumpled up bill. By the time we got out of there it was close to 11:45. Pretty ridiculous if you ask me, waited 45 minutes after being done with our meal to actually be able to leave. Major disappointment and thumbs down.

I met a friend here for dinner last night and was impressed with the interior - very nice compared to the BJs I've been to elsewhere. And not as crazily crowded as the one near me in Cerritos. I had a house salad and mini combo pizza which were both very good. BJs seems to be consistent at every location so my meal was just as I expected. I also got a margarita which was surprisingly well made. As with every BJs, the service was excruciatingly slow. If there was a cross between a snail and a turtle, the newly created creature would be instantly hired at BJs.

This restaurant is the best and this was my first BJ's restaurant visit when I celebrated my sister's birthday. First of all the hamburgers in this restaurant was the best burger in this restaurant especially the fries. I would like to try out the pizookie again when I get to visit again.
Awesome pasta! Very beautiful inside! Customer service is great! A little pricy but well worth it.

I like this place, I like their food and the ambience.  If you want to watch a sport event this is a great place to be. The servers are friendly and very nice. I recommend it for bday too. They give you a free pizuky.

First off let me start by saying I love to come to BJ's Restaurants and I have been to quite a few. I am not sure why I continue to frequent this particular restaurant. Each time I come to this restaurant I have encountered such poor service and incompetent servers. The wait time is horrible even if you call ahead and they give you an estimated time you will still have to wait the time they tell you when you actually arrive. So there is no point in calling ahead. Today my son and I decided to come because we haven't been here in quite some time and figured something should have changed since our last visit but no it is still the same. We decide to sit in the bar area in a booth as suggested by the hostess as service would be quicker. But no, we sat at the table for 11 minutes (yes, I timed it) before I had to go and complain before we were even greeted or offered drinks. Seriously? 11 minutes that is ridiculous!!! So finally they send someone over to greet us and apologize. We ordered our drinks and food as my son always orders the same thing. But the food takes even longer which is surprising since the place was practically empty. The food was overcooked and dry. Very disappointed:( My son didn't even finish his food. I will remember not to come to this particular restaurant again due to continued disappointment.

Great atmosphere and great selection on the menu.  I had the Great white deep dish pizza which was really good , Nugget had the patented Spaghetti in marinara sauce which she devoured, grandma had the spinach and artichoke deep dish mini which she almost polished off and the wife had a dish with chicken in a balsamic sauce?  Overall great food, service was a little slow but not to the point of annoying.  Calimari was tasty but could have used some flavor in the batter.  It was a little bland so the marinara dipping sauce was a definate save.  Mozzarella sticks as usual were pretty good and had to fight the nugget from eating them all.  Last but not least, make sure and bring a jacket just in case Bj's is an ice box.  That night We were there it felt like it was in the 60's.

This place... I'm always so torn. The food is pretty good but the service is just, ugh! It always seems so packed and understaffed. I feel like the waiters just forget about you and it takes forever to actually get your food! By the time you get it, you're just like "I guess I'll eat this"when in reality I just wanna get up and leave. I went once and they were actually out of silverware!! Whoever actually ended up with silverware at our table had to give up either a fork or a spoon so that everyone had something to use. Another crazy thing! My friend ordered some chicken dish that I guess usually comes with 2 chicken breasts and the waiter came back saying that they ran out of chicken & only had 1 breast so if she'd like something else. Keep in mind this was probably after more than 30 minutes of waiting for our food. RIDICULOUS!!

Bjs is a great place to go with family and friends.  Every time i go to Bjs I receive great service.  The food I have tried here is the pasta, pizzas, and some appetizers. They were pretty good, but the pazookies are a must!!!

Placed order online at 7:30 they said it would done at 7:45 and I thought wow that's some great service.  But I was wrong....so, so, so wrong. I get here at 7:45 and they ask my name and my order. I pay and then they start making my meal. It is now 8:15 and I'm still waiting. ...ugh

My partner and I flew in from SC and have never eaten at BJ's.  It was really good.  Our service was excellent!  Heather was our Server and Emily was our Food Runner.  They were very friendly and professional!

This place is good, and service is quick but it's loud in there.  Lot's of chatter goin' on but the foods great!  I've been here several times before so i know the food's great, the drinks are great, everything is great.

I booked my sister's bridal shower here last month, and I cannot express how happy I am with the outcome!  The manager was very helpful with all the arrangements.  We were able to reserve the semi-private area inside the restaurant (perfect, because it would have been too hot on the patio outside).  Our guests absolutely loved the food in our pre-set buffet (pasta, four kinds of pizza, Asian chicken salad).  The staff was extremely attentive, coming by at regular intervals to ask if we needed anything, and consistently providing refills without having to be called over.  I really liked the way all the waiters/waitresses went up to my sister and congratulated her.  They even provided boxes so that I could send the guests home with the leftovers. I would absolutely recommend booking a party at this particular BJ's.  It's easy for guests to find, there is ample parking, and the management makes the process very easy.  We were able to come in 30 min. ahead of time to set up decorations.  They did a great job seating other customers away from our party, to the extent that they were able to. Thanks to everyone at BJ's in Downey for making my sister's bridal shower such a fun and memorable event! :)

I came here for my friend's birthday dinner with about 10 other people and this is the worst BJ's I have ever been to. I found something in my drink and the waitress didn't replace it at all. I waited at least 30 mins and didn't get it replaced till I asked for a replacement. My friends also asked for a refill on her drink and they didn't refill hers at all. ! They did not include the side sauces we asked for and asked AT LEAST FOUR OR FIVE TIMES till they finally got us the sauces.  When we ordered pizookies, they got our orders wrong and asked "are you sure you didn't order this?" -_____- the pizookies were so hard eugk.

I came with a bunch of friends for a late night dinner during Happy Hour.  I started off with the Fresh Mozarella and Tomato Salad which I typically love but they overdid it with the mozarella on top. My boyfriend ordered their infamous root beer but much to his disappointment, they "ran out of chilled mugs." Therefore, they brought out the root beer on ice, diluting its goodness.  Next to us, we had a large party finishing up their food. Our waitress drops a dressing container on the floor which explodes over to our side, splattering my boyfriend's $200 pants. She apologizes once (only once) and informs us that she will let the manager know. (side story: another waiter spilled an entire platter of melted Pazookie ice cream on my bf a couple months back) We order the rest of our food. The large party next to us has a drunk idiot who is yelling at his friend to leave the restaurant. For about 20 minutes, he yells out, "HEY YOU! GET OUT! GET OUT!" Servers and managers just walk on by, not dealing with this unruly customer. Then, he creepily stares at me and tells me to stop smoking. I don't know what the hell he was on, but I wanted to punch his Raider loving face in. Long story short, the Happy Hour mini pizza was good as always. The manager NEVER showed up until we approached him, the manager didn't comp us for the soiled pants, and drunk lunatics ruined our potentially decent meal. I hate this BJ's.

Went there once, the service was horrible. The server kept forgetting to bring us basic things like napkins and refill our sodas.  He forgot to add toppings on our pizza like Pepperoni, and marinara so we got a dry pizza with cheese. I mean, how do you forget that esp when that's what we ordered. There was no Manager anywhere in sight so that place is not well kept together. Then I thought to give it a second chance and go back  Month later with my husband, It wasn't a good idea, super long wait. There was only two of us as apposed to there being other parties of 5 and 6 waiting. We waited 20 mins and saw they were seating people That came after us. What is that. BJ's Brewhouse in Downey is located at the Stonewood Shopping Center. If you've dined at any BJ's, the environment will be familiar to you. Generally friendly staff, from the Maître d' to the busboys. I would like to apologize to all who have rated BJ's or any equivalent restaurant higher than my 3 star rating. Restaurants of this calibre, in my estimation, cannot really be reviewed any higher. If you've read some of my reviews and noticed some of my ratings, one would perceive me to be inconsistent. Not so! I will rank a hole-in-the-wall located in an unpleasant part of town higher based upon what they offer with respect to the specialty of the art of their cuisine and at times, value. I have had fabulous meals at restaurants with lower Health Department grades than B, or even at some places people wouldn't even dare set food in because they have a numerical grade, being on the cusp of closure! So why only 3 stars? BJ's fall within a generic restaurants category. I suppose if I were a connoisseur of (handcrafted) micro brews, I would rate this place higher, but I'm not one to consume alcoholic beverages. Having dined here in the past because friends couldn't settle on anything else, I've tried the pizza, flat breads, avocado egg rolls, calamari,  stuffed potatoes, salads, burgers, pizookies, etc...nothing that I would say, "wow! I need to be here every day/week!" food is A-OK. Service, again is generally good. Facility is clean. My menu was a little gross, as each page was sticky! :-/ At this visit, I was with a group of 20. Several pizzas and appetizers were on order. As a side note, I'm quickly determining that pizza in today's vernacular bare resemblance much closer to focaccia! If I want pizza, it has to be thin crust. If I want thick crust, I'd order focaccia. I'm tired of seeing these super thick, deep dish pies labeled as "pizza" and thin crust being labeled as "flat bread"! Maybe I'm a bit critical, but I needed to vent! I ordered the Field of Greens Salad with Chicken along with a bottle of Pellegrino. They only stock one size of Pellegrino. I was surprised that the bottle was the tiny 250 ml bottle! As for the salad, it was tasty, but may have had too much dressing, at least for my tastes. My final thoughts....BJ's is a perfect place for teeny-boppers and 20 somethings, strapped for cash wanting to feel grown up. I'd venture to say they cater to the same demographic whom consider The Cheesecake Factory the pinnacle of culinary excellence! If you do a little investigating, you'll be surprised to find just how many restaurants there are around you offering a more excellent dining experience at a similar price point.
